title: [BUG]: Issue with running QuickStartDriver.java application

labels.name: needs author feedback
labels.description: Issue is waiting for the author to respond

body:
### System information
- **OS Platform and Distribution: Windows 10
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: via "pip install mlflow" in anaconda command prompt
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: mlflow, version 1.6.0
- **Python version**: Python 3.7.4
- **Exact command to reproduce**: i have run the maven option Runs as "Maven test" on Eclipse after importing the downloaded git hub source of mlflow on to a local machine, 

### Describe the problem
Can you please tell me how to avoid this error?
Failed to exec 'python -m mlflow.store.artifact.cli', needed to access artifacts
within the non-Java-native artifact store at './mlruns/159/37b0d1d5af6741c68b97825667b204fc/artifacts'. 
Please make sure mlflow is available on your local system path (e.g., from 'pip install mlflow')

This occurs when Java tries to execute line of code: 
client.logArtifact(runId_7, tempFile);


I am not sure what I could be missing. Does it require a special system environment variable to be set? If so which one? and what it should contain?

mlflow was installed via anaconda command prompt command: pip install mlflow
then I have a Java project application that is refferncing mlflow libraries and is able to execute everything apart from this line of code where it returns that error. I am not sure anymore what to try. 

Please provide some hints.  

Thanks for replies
Regards Marek
